intro: Reinwardtia repens, commonly known as the creeping reinwardtia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and can be submerged or floating depending on the water level. Reinwardtia repens is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and rivers.
